intro: Hieracium calophyllum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with prominent central disks. Hieracium calophyllum is known for its ornamental value and has been cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
